title: Offensive Tactics Against Government Forces in San Luis Potosi
name: Offensive Tactics Against Government Forces in San Luis Potosi
description: This data details all of the events where TCOs targeted government forces in San Luis Potosi, Mexico from 09/15/2011 to 12/14/2011.

properties.event summary: 11/02/2011: On Wednesday, in Catorce, San Luis Potosi, Mexico, the 12th Military Zone responded to a citizen report concerning the presence of armed people in the Real de Minas Hotel. When the military personnel arrived at the Hotel, the armed people opened fire at them. The military personnel returned fired and killed two criminals, injured one, arrested 10, and seized drugs, weapons and vehicles. No group claimed responsibility for this incident.
properties.event title: Military Personnel Repelled and Aggression Killing Two and Injuring One in Catorce, San Luis Potosi

properties.event summary: 09/25/2011: On Sunday night at 2230, in Rio Verde, San Luis Potosi, Mexico, two militants opened fire on officials who are posted at a nighttime check point at kilometer marker 30 on the Rio Verde-San Luis Potosi highway. Mexican Army personnel and Federal, State, and Municipal Police established the check point in response to civilian complaints. The militant individuals in a Chevy compact vehicle attacked the checkpoint with various firearms. The authorities returned fire, causing the gunmen to lose control of their vehicle, flip the car and crash. Both of the gunmen were killed in the accident, and during the shootout, one of the police authorities was wounded. After the accident police found and seized four rifles, a metal box containing 210 bullets of various calibers, 10 magazines for various weapons, a tactical vest, two tactical cartridge belts, and the Chevy vehicle. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.
properties.event title: Militants Attack Military, Federal, and State Police in San Luis Potosi

properties.event summary: 09/21/2011: On Wednesday, in San Luis Potosi, San Luis Potosi, Mexico, a state police operational director was shot and  killed. The individual was identified as 39 year old Gariel Castillo Ordaz (AKA EL Bolillo). The kidnappers tortured Catillo Ordaz and then murdered him with a shot to the head. No group claimed responsibility for this incident.
properties.event title: A State Police Operational Director was Killed in San Luis Potosi, San Luis Potosi

properties.event summary: 11/04/2011: On Friday, in Tamuin, Tamaulipas, Mexico, military personnel were conducting patrols on a dirt road when an armed group attacked them.  The military personnel returned fired.  Red Cross paramedics arrived on the scene and reported that three people were killed during the confrontation. The report did not specify if the three individuals killed were from the Army or armed group.  No group claimed responsibility for this incident.
properties.event title: Military Personnel Attacked in Tamuin, Tamaulipas
